1. When browsing localhost:8080:
Enter "password' OR 1=1" in the password field.

2. Downloading the PDF file and **copy past** the **white** content inside a new Paris.b64.txt file for example :
paris.pdf

3. This content will give you a base64 string which is an image :
base64 -d paris.b64.txt | tr -d " \t\n\r" > paris.jpg

4. This image has en embeded archive. Perform this steganography command to get the archive :
unzip -t paris.jpg

5. Open the the PDF file in binary mode and look for archive password in the end of the file :
4c314bbe43abb522ec64c592ede1a19cf1a5314d03d5eb

6. Unzip the archive and take a look to :
.bash_history

7. Store somewhere the modulo of the public.key :
openssl rsa -noout -text -inform PEM -in public.key -pubin
Modulus:
    00:bb:c3:a1:e4:7c:07:65:71:17:e9:8f:f5:6f:5e:
    7e:75:ea:d1:21:a7:17:39:80:48:44:5f:1f:3b:2f:
    18:e7:c3:12:77:80:b4:4a:2d:ed:e6:39:e3:1b:2e:
    b5:90:88:52:bc:b6:bf:0c:88:21:db:ab:d5:7d:c0:
    60:a8:04:7c:54:91:d6:6e:16:7a:79:ad:2a:a6:3a:
    fe:37:67:8b:5a:6f:cc:57:77:d5:1e:b3:76:da:e8:

    5a:6a:fd:5f:b0:4f:1a:1f:ed:6c:36:fa:78:c9:18:
    aa:20:ad:d2:49:e2:87:d1:56:09:6c:a3:6c:42:ab:
    13:b4:da:d4:ad:93:bd:ee:1b:b7:c7:61:bd:3d:54:
    2e:c6:4c:59:2e:de:1a:19:cf:1a:53:14:d0:3d:5e:
    b7:ba:cc:2a:8b:bd:a4:d1:8e:69:0a:b5:b5:17:97:
    12:49:ab

8. Open possibilities_prime1.py and change the parameters:
arr = { 
    "fb": "7f",
    "12": "f4",
    "54": "95",
    "57": "a4",
    "b5": "cd"
}
str = "<the public key above, without carriage returns>"

9. Compute all possible prime exponents :
python possibilities_prime1.py

10. Getting decimal version of modulo:

<=>
echo "ibase=16; " | bc
<=>


11. Run the PHP script (make sure to put the write modulo value in it) to find the appropriate key:
php possibilities_prime1.php

12. Decode the password file with the private key:
openssl rsautl -decrypt -in password.txt.enc -out password.decoded.txt -inkey priv.key

13. Decode the image :
gpg --batch --passphrase "253fe1529b72fec45f558379fb2cc920580ba2d9735e21862f5d8f9bfc85c767" --output lsb_RGB.png lsb_RGB.png.enc

14. Perform an LSB decode text on the image found:
For example with this library : https://github.com/RobinDavid/LSB-Steganography

15. Navigate to the link :
localhost:8080/96ca5d10ca206446f3853f038601e2f036cf5d00e425b6f1b9e8a5e4b48d4926
